channel.title: Animate an Object [PI] [Help]
channel.description:
I am currently trying to figure out how to make an object to move or to do an emote. I've done the Brimhaven Agility and I'd like the spinning blades to work like when you walk near one, it will move and attack you.
There's other obstacle like that too. It'd nice. Also: how can I make it so if someone fail the obstacle, he fall ?
Thank you !

item.title: Animate an Object [PI] [Help]
item.dc:creator: @I_Hope_I I Hope I
item.description:
@I_Hope_I wrote:

[quote=“The Wanderer, post:17, topic:397292”][quote author=I Hope I link=topic=494442.msg3616761#msg3616761 date=1307049550]

Object is the same thing as a character? You just have different reference points.

Well yeah I need something for objects, not characters.
[/quote]
You use the same process. That’s like saying you need a different tutorial for modeling an apple and a lamp. Modeling it will still be the same process, just one will take longer than the other or require different primitives. You will still do the same stuff.[/quote]

Ok thanks.
But do you know that packet that the other guy previously said ?

Read full topic

item.title: Animate an Object [PI] [Help]
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

[quote=“I Hope I, post:16, topic:397292”][quote author=The Wanderer link=topic=494442.msg3616211#msg3616211 date=1306984071]
Object is the same thing as a character? You just have different reference points.
[/quote]
Well yeah I need something for objects, not characters. :p[/quote]
You use the same process. That’s like saying you need a different tutorial for modeling an apple and a lamp. Modeling it will still be the same process, just one will take longer than the other or require different primitives. You will still do the same stuff.

Read full topic

item.description:

The Wanderer:

Object is the same thing as a character? You just have different reference points.

item.title: Animate an Object [PI] [Help]
item.dc:creator: @I_Hope_I I Hope I
item.description:
@I_Hope_I wrote:

[quote=“The Wanderer, post:12, topic:397292”]Yup, I would check the tutorial in the Models Request/Help. I believe it is section 4. At the very bottom of the page. http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,378223.msg2845356.html#msg2845356
Use that topic to understand VSKINS.
http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,387093.msg2899601.html#msg2899601
Here’s an old tutorial on how to use RSPoser.[/quote]

Oh thanks for these !

But they are for characters emote. I need something for object, or can I do object on this aswell ?

Read full topic

item.title: Animate an Object [PI] [Help]
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

Metaseq for animation skins. RsPoser for the animation.

Read full topic

item.title: Animate an Object [PI] [Help]
item.dc:creator: @I_Hope_I I Hope I
item.description:
@I_Hope_I wrote:

So I could use RsPoser for that ?

item.title: Animate an Object [PI] [Help]
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

Animation skins such as TSKIN, VSKIN1 (possibly VSKIN2, just depends), and PRI. Frame by frame animations are made in any animation program that supports 3D models, but RsPoser was made just for making animations for RSPS.

Read full topic

item.description:

item.title: Animate an Object [PI] [Help]
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

Add animation skins to the object. Then make a frame by frame animation for the object. Then play the animation whenever such and such happens for said object.

Read full topic

It would be in a method in the client class with Object in it right.
I’ve got no idea.

item.title: Animate an Object [PI] [Help]
item.dc:creator: @Descracescape Descracescape
item.description:
@Descracescape wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”][quote author=xxxtilllyxxx link=topic=494442.msg3614783#msg3614783 date=1306880454]
To move an object in PI you have to go to src\Server\World\Objectmanager.java and look for the public void loadCustomSpawns

public void loadCustomSpawns(Client c) {
	c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(6163, 3083, 3488, 1, 10);

change X is 6163 And Y is 3082 and H is 1. Always leave 10 at 10.
[/quote]did you even read the topic u idiot

its asking to make an object move as an animation (i.e. spinning)[/quote]

You tell him. And I’m actually wondering the same thing… It wouldn’t be in the actionhandler.java file would it? I’ve been jacking around to try to get it to work but always come to a conclusion with an error.

Read full topic

item.title: Animate an Object [PI] [Help]
item.dc:creator: @xxxtilllyxxx xxxtilllyxxx
item.description:
@xxxtilllyxxx wrote:

To move an object in PI you have to go to src\Server\World\Objectmanager.java and look for the public void loadCustomSpawns

public void loadCustomSpawns(Client c) {
	c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(6163, 3083, 3488, 1, 10);

change X is 6163 And Y is 3082 and H is 1. Always leave 10 at 10.

Read full topic
